Posts.Content: Jul 28, 2008 12:02PM childminder10 wrote: Hi Julie  I had my sentinel node biopsy 3 weeks ago.  I went in the morning of the surgery and had my dye injected about 2 hours before op. Injecting the dye is a really simple procedure, not really painful, just like having a normal injection. You should be absolutely fine to drive home afterwards.     I was allowed home the same day as the surgery.  Be warned that you will have blue wee for a few days and a blue patch on yr boob which can last for several month.  I recovered from the small op after only a few days. You should get the results from the biopsy roughly 2 weeks after operation. I am scheduled for a full mastectomy with reconstructive surgery on Friday.   Good luck on Wednesday and keep positive - it has certainly kept me going. Brenda D/X 3/7/08 Grade 3 IDC 0 Nodes Infected
Posts.Title: SNB Dye Injection jmfl Jule
